subject: RE: [junit] checking for test coverage
msgSnippet: I wonder about the converse: projects that actively try to test their code, but do not use the test first strategy... Chris P.S. If I had a good tool, I could
messageBody:
I wonder about the converse: projects that actively try to test their code,
but do not use the test first strategy...

Chris

P.S. If I had a good tool, I could tell you the stats for my project :-P

-----Original Message-----
From: Steve Freeman [mailto:steve@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 05, 2002 4:06 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] checking for test coverage


From: "Vladimir Bossicard" <vladimir@...>
> Off the record: it would be interesting to know what is the average
> coverage of the Test First Design method: 80%, 90%, 95%, 100%?

in Java, it seems to be about 98/99%.

Steve
